title: 1. Define your Kubernetes deployment
description: Create high-level deployment definitions for your Kubernetes Cluster using Fabrikate. Fabrikate is a tool that allows you to write DRY resource definition and configuration for multiple environments. It leverages the Helm chart ecosystem.

title: 2. Setup a CI/CD pipeline
description: The CI/CD pipeline will generate Kubernetes resource manifests from the Fabrikate definitions.

title: 3. Check-in the resource manifests to git repository
description: The CI/CD pipeline automatically checks-in the generated resource manifests into a resource manifest git repository.

title: 4. Set up infrastructure
description: Setup your Kubernetes cluster infrastructure. Bedrock provides various Terraform templates that include Flux.

title: 5. Automatically deploy resource manifests
description: Once Flux is installed in the cluster, it will detect changes made to the resource manifest repository and apply those changes to the cluster.
